content.user_title: Review web interfaces for design compliance
content.value_statement: Developers often ship web interfaces with accessibility issues or inconsistent design patterns. This skill fetches and applies the latest Web Interface Guidelines to audit code against best practices for usability, accessibility, and consistency.
actual_capabilities: Fetches latest Web Interface Guidelines from remote repository
Reads specified files or file patterns for review
Checks code against all rules in the fetched guidelines
Outputs findings in terse file:line format for easy navigation
limitations: Requires network access to fetch latest guidelines from GitHub
Only audits against provided guidelines; does not infer additional rules
Does not automatically fix issues, only reports them

use_cases.title: Frontend Code Review
use_cases.description: Review React, HTML, or CSS files for compliance with Vercel's web interface guidelines before shipping to production.

use_cases.title: Accessibility Audit
use_cases.description: Check web pages and components for accessibility issues including keyboard navigation, ARIA labels, and semantic HTML.

use_cases.title: Design System Compliance
use_cases.description: Audit existing codebases against design system guidelines to identify inconsistencies and technical debt.

best_practices: Fetch fresh guidelines before each review to ensure compliance with the latest standards
Review findings in file:line order to efficiently locate and fix issues
Use the skill proactively during development, not just before release
anti_patterns: Ignoring findings without understanding the underlying guideline rationale
Reviewing stale code without fetching the latest guidelines first
Treating all findings as equally critical; prioritize based on user impact

faq.question: What does this skill actually do?
faq.answer: It fetches the latest Web Interface Guidelines from GitHub, reads your specified files, and checks them against all rules in the guidelines. Findings are output in file:line format.

faq.question: Where do the guidelines come from?
faq.answer: The skill fetches guidelines from the vercel-labs/web-interface-guidelines repository on GitHub. This ensures you always audit against the most current standards.

faq.question: Can this skill fix issues automatically?
faq.answer: No, this skill only reports compliance issues. It does not modify your code. You must manually address the findings based on the reported line numbers.

faq.question: What file types can it review?
faq.answer: Any text-based file can be reviewed. The skill is most effective on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and other web-related code.

faq.question: Does it check accessibility?
faq.answer: Yes, if the fetched guidelines include accessibility rules, the skill will check for issues like missing ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation problems, and color contrast.

faq.question: How often should I run this skill?
faq.answer: Run it during code review, before commits, or when integrating new components. Fetching fresh guidelines each time ensures you catch issues against current standards.
